On Coursera with Professor Laurie Santos

## Introduction

Reasons of this course:
- The science of psychology has a lot of new insights
	- many new successful techniques to "nudge" people to the right direction
- We need these insights pretty badly
	- we are not as happy as we hope for
	- Americans are among the most unhappy people in the world
- I (Professor) need these insights pretty badly

---

## Misconceptions about happiness





### G.I. Joe Fallacy
Professor Santos, a professor in psychology, has below-average happiness. Why? She and colleague developed a theory:

**The G.I. Joe Fallacy** = the mistaken idea that "knowing" is half the battle.

Knowing is not half the battle. Merely knowing something is not enough to change our behavior. One example is optical illusion, knowing how the illusion works does not make us immune to the illusion.

### Things we think will make us happy (but don't)
1. Good job
Being rejected by a dream job matters a lot less than we think. Gilbert et al. (1998) did an experiment letting college students predict their drop in happiness after being rejected by a job. The results they get was
